chapterTitle: Return, Risk, and The Security Market Line

columns.text: This exercise asks us to determine securities' expected return and the risk-free rate.
The **expected return** is the net income or loss that an investor predicts on investments given known interest rates.

Let's first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Pete Corp.  | | 
|Beta |1.25|
|Expected return  | 0.1323|
|Repete Co. | | 
|Beta |0.87|
|Expected return  | 0.0967|

First, let us insert the provided data to the formula from step 3. As an illustration, here's what it looks like: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\dfrac{\text{0.1323}{- }{R}_{f}}{\text{1.25}}&=\dfrac{\text{0.0967}{- }{R}_{f}}{\text{0.87}}\\

\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us cross multiply both equations. This is done by multiplying the denominator of one fraction by the numerator. This is done to calculate the risk-free rate for both securities.

$$\begin{aligned}
{\text{0.87 $\times$ }}{\text{(0.1323}{- }{R}_{f}}{{)}}&={\text{1.25 $\times $}}{\text{(0.0967}{- }{R}_{f}}{{)}}\\
{\text{0.1151}{- }{0.87R}_{f}}{{}}&={\text{0.1209}{- }{1.25R}_{f}}{{}}\\

\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us rearrange the formula by shifting the risk-free rate to the other side. This is done as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}

{{1.25R}_{f}}{\text{}{- }{0.87R}_{f}}{{}}&={\text{0.1209}{-0.1151  }}\\
{\text{0.38R}_{f}}&={\text{0.0058  }}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Since we have already determined the risk-free rate, we will now determine the market expected return by using the formula from step 3. Let us now compute the market expected return of Pete Corp. which is computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{0.1323}&={\text{0.0153}} + {{[1.25}}{\text{ $\times$ }}{\text{(R}_{m}} - {\text{0.0153}}{)]}\\
\text{0.1323}&={\text{0.0153}} + {{1.25}}{\text{R}_{m}} - {\text{0.01913}}\\
\text{0.1323}&= {{1.25}} {\text{R}_{m}} - {\text{0.0038}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us rearrange the formula by shifting the 1.25 Rm to other side. This is done as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{0.1323}&= {{1.25}} {{R}_{m}} - {\text{0.0038}}\\
{{- 1.25}} {\text{R}_{m}}&= \text{- 0.1323} - {\text{0.0038}}\\
{{- 1.25}} {\text{R}_{m}}&= {\text{-0.1361}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Let us now compute the market expected return of Repete Corp. which is computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{0.0967}&={\text{0.0153}} + {{[0.87}}{\text{ $\times$ }}{\text{(R}_{m}} - {\text{0.0153}}{)]}\\
\text{0.0967}&={\text{0.0153}} + {{0.87}}{\text{R}_{m}} - {\text{0.0133}}\\
\text{0.0967}&= {{0.87}} {\text{R}_{m}} + {\text{0.002}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us rearrange the formula by shifting the 0.87Rm to other side. This is done as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{0.0967}&= {{0.87}} {\text{R}_{m}} + {\text{0.002}}\\
{{- 0.87}} {\text{R}_{m}}&= \text{- 0.0967} + {\text{0.002}}\\
{{- 0.87}} {\text{R}_{m}}&= {\text{-0.0947}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
**To conclude, the risk-free rate of both securities is 1.53%, while the market expected rate is 10.89%.**
